cyclone.name: PHILIPPE
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest today, skim just northeast of the northern Leeward Islands Monday–Monday night, then accelerate northward well east of the Virgin Islands toward the open Atlantic south of Bermuda.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No direct landfall; closest passage expected just NE of the northern Leeward Islands

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Atlantic coasts of the northern Leeward Islands, U.S./British Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico subject to large swells and rip currents
weather_observation.wind: Low probability (≤5%) of tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–30 mph possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of showers could produce 1–2 inches of rain with isolated higher totals, creating brief localized runoff issues.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents on north and east-facing beaches beginning late Sunday and persisting into Tuesday.
